definitions.definition: Used to introduce a clause, phrase, verb infinitive, adverb or other non-noun complement forming an exception or qualification to something previously stated.
examples: You look a bit like my sister, except (that) she has longer hair.
I never made fun of her except teasingly.
To survive, I did everything except steal.
Come any time except between ten and twelve.

definitions.definition: Loosely, used to introduce a contrastive statement explaining why something wasn't successful, didn't happen, etc.
examples: They fired tear gas at us, except the wind was blowing the wrong way.
I almost walked out, except I remembered the promise I had made.

definitions.definition: Unless ; used to introduce a hypothetical case in which an exception may exist.

main_definition: Used to introduce a clause, phrase, verb infinitive, adverb or other non-noun complement forming an exception or qualification to something previously stated.
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) Loosely, used to introduce a contrastive statement explaining why something wasn't successful, didn't happen, etc.
( archaic ) Unless ; used to introduce a hypothetical case in which an exception may exist.
